Package Collecto

Class ComputerPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Collecto.ComputerPlayer
  • public class ComputerPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a beginner and an intermediate AI which can play Collecto instead of a regular user. It is integrated into the Client class so that a player can call on it to play a game for them.

    The strategy of the beginner AI is to make the very first possible move that it encounters.

    The strategy of the intermediate AI is to calculate all current possible moves, and see how many balls they would gain by making that move, after which the move that gains the the highest amount of balls is selected as the next move that the AI makes.

    See Also:
    Client

      • ComputerPlayer

        public ComputerPlayer​(int level)
        Constructs a ComputerPlayer with a given level of difficulty.
        Parameters:
        level - requested difficulty level for this ComputerPlayer
        Requires:
        level to be either 1 and 2

    • Method Detail

      • makeBeginnerMoveSingle

        private static Move makeBeginnerMoveSingle​(GridBoard board)
        Private help method to determine if there is a single move possible on board provided.

        Works by iterating through all moves and trying to find a possible move. If such a move is found — returns this move, if no possible moves found returns null.

        Parameters:
        board - the board used to determine a move
        Returns:
        first possible move or null
        Requires:
        board != null

      • makeBeginnerMove

        public static Move[] makeBeginnerMove​(GridBoard board)
        Looks for possible single or double moves. If no move is found returns null.

        Description of work:

        Firstly uses makeBeginnerMoveSingle() to see whether there is any move possible with a single push. If that method returns a move - return this move. If that method returns null - try to find a move with two pushes by iterating through all possible moves and for each iteration looking for possible second moves using the same algorithm as makeBeginnerSingleMove().

        Parameters:
        board - board to find a move on
        Returns:
        an array of either 1 or 2 moves or null if no moves are found

      • getLevel

        public int getLevel()
        Returns the difficulty level of this ComputerPlayer.
        Returns:
        difficulty level of this ComputerPlayer

      • makeMove

        public Move[] makeMove​(GridBoard board)
        Determines the next move of the computer player using makeBeginnerMove() or makeIntermediateMove() depending on the level of this ComputerPlayer.

        If level == 1, this method uses makeBeginnerMove(GridBoard), if level == 2, this method uses makeIntermediateMove(GridBoard).

        Parameters:
        board - the specified GridBoard on which the AI will attempt to make a move
        Returns:
        a determined move
        Requires:
        board != null
        Ensures:
        return is a valid move or null

      • ballsFromMove

        private int ballsFromMove​(GridBoard board,
                          Move move)
        Determines the amount of balls gained from a certain move, so that the intermediate level AI can use this as a score to see what move is the best move.
        Parameters:
        board - the board on which the move is made
        move - the move that has to be checked
        Returns:
        amount of balls gained by making this move

      • makeIntermediateMoveSingle

        private Move[] makeIntermediateMoveSingle​(GridBoard board)
        Private help method to determine if there is a single move possible on a provided board by using the intermediate algorithm.

        Works by iterating through all moves and trying to find a possible move. If no possible moves found returns null. If any moves found — finds the best move using ballsFromMove(GridBoard, Move) and finds this best move by comparing amount of balls gained from that specific move. The best move is considered to be the move with most balls gained from this move.

        Parameters:
        board - the board on which the moves are made and compared
        Returns:
        best move in one push or null

      • makeIntermediateMove

        private Move[] makeIntermediateMove​(GridBoard board)
        Looks for possible move in either one or two pushes. If no such move is found returns null.

        Description of how this method works:

        Firstly uses makeIntermediateMoveSingle() to see whether there is a move possible with a single push. If it returns a move - returns this move and finishes. If the method returns null - tries to find a move with double pushes by iterating over all possible moves and for each iteration looking for second possible moves using the same algorithm as makeIntermediateSingleMove().

        Parameters:
        board - the board on which the move is determined
        Returns:
        an array of either 1 or 2 moves or null if no moves found
